resources.string: Oops! Please try again or contact support.
No spreadsheet found, please contact support.
Problem with new backend, old backend worked fine.
Problem loading data, please try again later.
Click this button to report your medication doses.
Click this button to report any symptoms you have.
Click this button to see a log of your data.

You can enter medication doses, symptoms, and stress factors anytime, but the app will remind you to check in daily. Don\'t worry if you make a mistake, just try again and enter the correct information. The app only keeps the latest entry for each day so you have until midnight to update your daily tracking info
Fill in the number of doses you\'ll have taken by the end of the day. (NS: Dose not scheduled or needed)
Fill in the number of doses you\'ll have taken by the end of the day. (NS: Dose not scheduled or needed)
Did you take your morning medication?
Did you take your evening medication?
Record the worst intensity you had for each symptom today.
Individual scales can be seen by tapping the icon in the top right corner or the faces image.
No data for selected time range.
Problem with new backend, pulling from old backend.
You do not have the camera support
Please create a 4 digit PIN. MS101.me will ask you for this PIN each time you open it to ensure your data is kept secure.

DO NOT USE THIS APP FOR EMERGENCIES. \nLEAP-NEURO DISCLAIMS ALL LIABILITY FOR USE IN CONNECTION WITH EMERGENCIES. \nTHIS APP SHOULD NOT BE USED AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR DIRECT COMMUNICATION WITH HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS. CALL YOUR HEALTHCARE PROVIDER DIRECTLY TO REPORT HEALTH-RELATED QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS.
The PIN you entered was incorrect.
Please describe any symptoms you\'re experiencing. Your audio note is limited to 20 seconds, so please be concise!
You have an unsaved audio note. Would you like to save it or discard it?

After setting up this widget, you will get ongoing notifications at certain times of day to help you track your dosing schedule. \nPlease choose what medication you would like to have this widget track from the list below.
You\'re not tracking a medication that can use this widget, feel free to delete it from your home screen.
You\'re tracking %s, please add our one click dose widget to your home screen.
Click the pill widget to report your first Tecfidera dose.
Click the pill widget to report your second Tecfidera dose.
Your Tecfidera doses have been updated on your data dashboard.
Simulates playback functionality using a local audio file

To report the doses of medication you've taken during the day, simply fill in the bubble of how many doses of each medication you've taken today. 
 
Fill in NS if you aren't scheduled or if you don't need the medication today.
 
Fill in 0 if you've missed all doses for today.

To report the doses of medication you've taken during the day, simply fill in the bubble of how many doses of each medication you've taken today. 
 
Fill in NS if you aren't scheduled or if you don't need the medication today.
 
Fill in 0 if you've missed all doses for today.

To report the doses of morning medication you've taken during the day, simply fill in the bubble of how many doses of each medication you've taken this morning. 
 
Fill in NS if you aren't scheduled or if you don't need the medication this morning.
 
Fill in 0 if you've missed all doses for today.

To report the doses of afternoon medication you've taken during the day, simply fill in the bubble of how many doses of each medication you've taken this afternoon. 
 
Fill in NS if you aren't scheduled or if you don't need the medication this morning.
 
Fill in 0 if you've missed all doses for today.

To report the doses of evening medication you've taken during the day, simply fill in the bubble of how many doses of each medication you've taken this afternoon. 
 
Fill in NS if you aren't scheduled or if you don't need the medication this morning.
 
Fill in 0 if you've missed all doses for today.

ADL: Activities of daily living (Dressing, showering, cooking, eating) 
 
 Pain 
0: No pain 
1: Mild - Can do 100\%% ADL 
2: Moderate - Can do 100\%% of ADL if I change my routine 
3: High - Can't mentally focus; can't do 100\%% ADL 
4: Severe - Must have personal assistance with ADL 
5: Very severe - Bed rest; personal assistance with ADL 
 
 Mobility (Balance and Walking) 
0: No difficulty 
1: Mild - Some difficulty, but can be ignored 
2: Moderate - Walk slower; hold or lean on walls/furniture/other 
3: High - Sometimes need cane or other device 
4: Severe - Always need cane or other device 
5: Very Severe - Require personal assistance 
 
 Fatigue 
0: No fatigue 
1: Mild - Tiring easily, but can do 100\%% ADL 
2: Moderate - Must stop frequently, but can do 100\%% ADL 
3: High - Can't do 100\%% ADL 
4: Severe - Require personal assistance with ADL 
5: Very Severe - Bed rest; personal assistance with ADL 
 
 Brain Fog 
0: No brain fog 
1: Mild - Somewhat forgetful; no effect on ADL 
2: Moderate - Easily confused, can only focus on one task at a time 
3: High - Trouble finding words; poor focus; effect on mood 
4: Severe - Trouble speaking; withdrawn; frustrated 
5: Very Severe - Withdrawn; can't recall personal info

Family Stress 
0: None 
1: Mild - Stress takes <10\%% of mental focus 
2: Moderate - Stress takes 10\%%-25\%% of mental focus 
3: High - Stress takes 25\%%-50\%% of mental focus 
4: Severe - Stress takes 50\%%-90\%% of mental focus 
5: Very Severe - Stress takes 90\%%-100\%% of mental focus 
 
 Work Stress 
0: None 
1: Mild - Stress takes <10\%% of mental focus 
2: Moderate - Stress takes 10\%%-25\%% of mental focus 
3: High - Stress takes 25\%%-50\%% of mental focus 
4: Severe - Stress takes 50\%%-90\%% of mental focus 
5: Very Severe - Stress takes 90\%%-100\%% of mental focus 
 
 Sleep 
0: None 
1: Mild - 7+ hours restful sleep 
2: Moderate - 6-7 hours restful sleep 
3: High - 5-6 hours restful sleep 
4: Severe - 4-5 hours restful sleep 
5: Very Severe - <4 hours restful sleep 
 
 Heat/Humidity 
0: None 
1: Mild - <1 hour exposure 
2: Moderate - 1-2 hours exposure 
3: High - 2-3 hours exposure 
4: Severe - 3-4 hours exposure 
5: Very Severe - 4+ hours exposure
Please enter your full name here
